Magical Turkey

Book now

Overview

A sailing trip along the Turkish coastline is an unforgettable travel experience. Your vivid encounter with the elements of nature, your daily yoga sessions, the benefits of a vegetarian, fresh and healthy Mediterranean cuisine, together with the option of an energy spending massage, or a snorkeling tour, all will combine to bring your spirit and body in balance. Most rapidly you will have forgotten about the everyday stress that you might experience in your professional life.The day starts with a sun salutation, or a smooth awakening yoga practice, in the pleasant light of the first sunbeams, as the sun climbs over the horizon of a deep blue sea.

A choice of excursions on land will give you plenty of opportunities to get to know the nature, the culture and the history of this region. Exquisite jaunts to historical, archeological sites, herb hiking tours, or a visit to a nomadic village or a traditional Turkish bath – a hammam. They all share enriching insights into the wealth of the eastern Mediterranean culture.

Practical info

Dates:

17 - 23 October 2020

Location:

Bodrum, Turkey

Recommended for:

Sail with us along the Mediterranean and Agean Sea while experiencing the wonderful Turkish culture

Price: EUR 1.199 in a shared cabin with own bathroom

Exclusions

Not included are:

* Air fares

* Other beverages: smoothies, fruit juice, soft drinks & alcoholic beverages

* Tip and gratuity for the crew (commonly around €50,- p.P.)

* Wi-Fi use €10, -  week

* Entrance fees to the archaeological sites

* 1 x dinner with fish specialties at a local fish restaurant: (around €17-, €25,-) p.p.

Optional Daily Excursions and Courses (booking on the boat):

* 3 cooking classes € 120, - (minimum 3 participants)

* SUP YOGA LESSON per hour €30,- (including Sup-Board & lessons)

* SUP BOARD rent price for 1 hour €10, -

* SUP BOARD rent price for a week (Sunday to Friday evening) 1 Sup-Board €140, - (please before reservation).

* Turkish Bath "Hamam" Peeling and Olive Oil Soap foam Massage, excursion to the Old Town in Mugla or Milas €49,- p.P

* Nomad mountain village trip and hiking, visiting a village family and lunch with the family €35, -p.P

* Hiking along the coastline €15,- p.P

* Lunch trip by canal reeds with fishing boat to the village Akçapınar and then walk through sesame groves. €35,- p.P

* Excursion in Bodrum, Walking to Windmils - Ancient Theatre - Oldtown and Mousoleum €35,-p.P

 

Inclusions

* 7 night’s accommodation on the yacht

* Vegetarian meals: 7x brunch breakfast, lunchtime fruit, 4 pm Tea-time with cookies and 6x dinner will be served (not included are: 1 dinner that will be arranged in a local fish restaurant).

* Airport Transfer

* Water and tea are served free of charge on the boat, throughout the day

* 2 Yoga Classes per day – (no need to bring your own yoga mat), mornings and evenings 60-90 min. The yoga sessions start on Sunday evening and the last session is given on Friday morning.

* High quality yoga mats, blocks, belts and blankets are provided on board, in sufficient quantity.

* Equipment for snorkeling and some water sports equipment are provided on board.

* 2x a week there is an option of sailing between 11 am until 4 pm  (depending on weather conditions)

* Harbour Tax in Turkey

* Crew service 

* Ship water 

* Diesel & Gasoline 

* Bed Linen & Bath towels 

* Use of equipment on board 

* Yacht insurance (we advise you to take out your own individual travel insurance)

 

FAQ

What do I need to bring?

Linen for the beds is provided but it would be great if you could bring your own towel. Besides that just the usual travel equipment like swim suit, toiletries, comfortable clothes etc.

When does the boat leave?

Embarkation Saturday from 2 pm, disembarkation Saturday 9 am. YogaCruising reserves the right to modify traveling routes, time schedules and the sequence of events due to weather conditions or organizational demands.

If I arrive or leave any other day than Saturday can you help me with accommodation?

Early arrivals are possible if you have better direct flights to Bodrum. Our cooperation with 2 hotels at Marina 5 is walking distance to our office and anchorage. Pomelon Club Hotel on the Beach and Martı Pension.

 

About Bodrum, Turkey

Bodrum is a district and a port city in Muğla Province, in the southwestern Aegean Region of Turkey. It is located on the southern coast of Bodrum Peninsula, at a point that checks the entry into the Gulf of Gökova, and is also the center of the eponymous district. The city was called Halicarnassus (ancient Greek: Αλικαρνασσός) of Caria in ancient times and was famous for housing the Mausoleum of Mausolus, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Built by the Knights Hospitaller in the 15th century, Bodrum Castle overlooks the harbour and the marina.
